$interpreted: : Three years later...
Charle: Morris...
Charle: The headmaster is asking what we are doing moving so many things to this old storage room again.
Charle: You still haven't solved that formula?
Morris: Yeah. If we want it to not be easily manipulated by other things, the Guardian must have a basic level of self-consciousness...
Morris: Allowing a lifeless item to have a conscious while at the same time making it follow commands and operate stably...
Morris: Is this truly impossible...
Morris: Hmph, looks like we'll just have to gamble on it!
Morris: Charle, go and get some rubbings of the stone tablets on the prairie!
Charle: You want to decrypt the mysterious runes carved on the stone tablets?
Charle: But even the Academy has not even decrypted a small fraction of those carvings!
Morris: Being stuck here with no solution is not an option. A quick detour might just give us the spark we need.
Charle: Alright then. I just finished teaching my class. I'll get going right away. You get some rest first.
Morris: Understood. If I get hungry, I'll fix dinner myself.
Morris: I might accidentally make too much...so when you come back, let's eat together.
Charle: Thanks.
Charle: Next time, let me cook for a change.
Charle: I've studied quite a bit of cooking myself too~
Morris: M-Must not give him the chance to cook no matter what...
Morris: Where the heck did he get the confidence when it comes to cooking? Baffles me to no end.
Charle: Hmm, judging by the marks on the map, I should be done rubbing all the stone tablets around this area.

Charle: "Stone tablets are messages passed down by the ancient people."

"They contain massive amounts of currently unknown ancient knowledge."
Charle: The research speculations that have been there since the founding days of Rune Academy, will they really help us complete the Runic Guardian?
Charle: By the way...
Charle: I feel so tired after just one little run.
Charle: I've spent the last several years cooped up in the school doing experiments. Could it be that I'm just now feeling the after-effects?
Charle: Can we really finish the Runic Guardian without a hitch...
Charle: The sound of combat?
Charle: Clovis!
Aosta: Ceres?
Aosta: Hmph, so it's you...
Charle: Clovis, deal with the monsters first!
Aosta: Yes.
Aosta: Didn't expect to see you at a place like this. When did you develop an interest in history as well?
Charle: I wasn't interested until I heard Morris' explanation. I've also started to understand some of the basics.
Aosta: Professor Dietrich? He's with you? What exactly is he so busy about these days?
Charle: Oh, right. You became a newly-appointed teacher two months ago. I don't think you two have seen each other since then...
Charle: We are trying to figure out a method from these ancient tablets that can allow the Runic Guardian to operate.
Charle: However, Morris still hasn't solved the key formulas...
Aosta: Hmph, what makes you the one?
Charle: What?
Aosta: You don't have what it takes to help him. Take me to professor Dietrich.
Charle: ...Alrighty.
Morris: Charle, I've reached an agreement with the headmaster. I'll move my private lab to this location.
Morris: Afterward, when we apply for experiment equipment, we can...
Morris: Clovis? Why the hell are you here!
Charle: Apologies. I figured that Clovis might be able to help us out.
Morris: Why did you make this decision on your own? I never asked for help! Or did you think that I don't have what it takes to solve this problem!
Morris: The formulas I previously wrote have been erased!? Who gave you two the permission to do such a thing!
Aosta: Professor Dietrich, please take a closer look.
Morris: A solution like this exists?
Morris: Although it takes a small detour, it provides space for a change here, which then allows the purpose to be fulfilled. Why didn't I think of this?
Morris: You solved all of this yourself?
Aosta: Yes. Ceres didn't help in any shape or form.
Morris: Gotta hand it to you, Clovis...you really are amazing...

Charle: What are you so depressed about, Mr. Genius?
With this, the experiment can keep going, right?
Morris: Yes. Looks like we can perform the experiment again in just a few days.
Aosta: Professor Dietrich, can I accompany you?
Charle: Clovis, you're the one who solved this formula. Of course you...
Morris: Nope. No~~pe~
Morris: This is not something a person of your level should come in contact with. Regarding this case, I will find some other time to thank you.
Morris: We're about to conduct the next phase. You should leave right now!
Aosta: But...
Morris: Charle, let's perform the final adjustments right away!
Charle: Morris, didn't expect that it would be your student who saved us.
Morris: You talk too much. You should hurry and set up the formations!
Charle: Yes, professor Dietrich~
Morris: You little...
Charle: Hahaha~

Model.Text: Three years later...
Morris...
The headmaster is asking what we are doing moving so many things to this old storage room again.
You still haven't solved that formula?
Yeah. If we want it to not be easily manipulated by other things, the Guardian must have a basic level of self-consciousness...
Allowing a lifeless item to have a conscious while at the same time making it follow commands and operate stably...
Is this truly impossible...
Hmph, looks like we'll just have to gamble on it!
Charle, go and get some rubbings of the stone tablets on the prairie!
You want to decrypt the mysterious runes carved on the stone tablets?
But even the Academy has not even decrypted a small fraction of those carvings!
Being stuck here with no solution is not an option. A quick detour might just give us the spark we need.
Alright then. I just finished teaching my class. I'll get going right away. You get some rest first.
Understood. If I get hungry, I'll fix dinner myself.
I might accidentally make too much...so when you come back, let's eat together.
Thanks.
Next time, let me cook for a change.
I've studied quite a bit of cooking myself too~
M-Must not give him the chance to cook no matter what...
Where the heck did he get the confidence when it comes to cooking? Baffles me to no end.
Hmm, judging by the marks on the map, I should be done rubbing all the stone tablets around this area.
